outline:
1. to snatch away, deliver, rescue, save, strip, plunder
    1. (Niphal)
      1. to tear oneself away, deliver oneself
      2. to be torn out or away, be delivered
    2. (Piel)
      1. to strip off, spoil
      2. to deliver
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to take away, snatch away
      2. to rescue, recover
      3. to deliver (from enemies or troubles or death)
      4. to deliver from sin and guilt
    4. (Hophal) to be plucked out
    5. (Hithpael) to strip oneself
kjv_def: [idiom] at all, defend, deliver (self), escape, [idiom] without fail, part, pluck, preserve, recover, rescue, rid, save, spoil, strip, [idiom] surely, take (out).
strongs_def: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
